macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Major Indexes Rise on Friday, Erase Weekly Losses for S&P 500
items.summary: The S&P 500 rose 0.9% to 6,834.50 on December 19, erasing its weekly losses with a 0.1% gain; Dow added 0.4% to 48,134.89 but fell 0.7% for the week, Nasdaq gained 1.3% to 23,307.62 up 0.5% weekly, and Russell 2000 rose 0.9% to 2,529.42 but down 0.9% weekly.[1][3]

items.title: AI Stocks Rebound, Technology Sector Leads Gains
items.summary: US equities gained on cooler CPI data and positive AI stock moves like Nvidia; Technology sector up 1.61-2.08%, Health Care and Energy outperformed, while Consumer Discretionary lagged amid NKE down 10% pre-market post-earnings.[1][3]

items.title: Nike and FedEx Shares Decline After Earnings
items.summary: Nike (NKE) fell about 10% pre-market despite initial positive reaction to earnings; FedEx (FDX) saw modest early decline on conservative guidance.[1]

items.title: Weekly Market Volatility Driven by Big Tech Weakness
items.summary: Major US indexes ended week modestly lower with S&P 500 down nearly 2% mid-week before Friday rebound; weakness in mega-cap tech, AI stocks, Nasdaq and Russell down ~3%, VIX rose, oil prices fell 3%.[2][3]

items.title: Bank of Japan Raises Rates to 30-Year High
items.summary: Japanese stocks closed higher after Bank of Japan raised benchmark interest rate to highest in 30 years.[3]

items.title: Oracle Surges on TikTok Joint Venture, Winnebago Beats Estimates
items.summary: Oracle rose sharply after new US TikTok joint venture; Winnebago Industries soared on profits and revenue beating estimates.[3]

items.title: ByteDance on Track for $50B Profit in 2025
items.summary: TikTok owner ByteDance projected to achieve $50 billion profit in 2025.[1]

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Cash Surges 12.37% Weekly Amid Institutional Buying
items.summary: Bitcoin Cash (BCH) rose 12.37% over the past week despite a 3.6% 24-hour dip to $602.3, driven by institutional buying, high open interest of $761.48M, and bullish technical signals like a potential breakout above $615.

items.title: SBI VC Trade Launches XRP Lending Service in Japan
items.summary: Japanese exchange SBI VC Trade, a subsidiary of SBI Holdings, opened a new recruitment round for its 'Rent Coin' lending service supporting 34 assets including XRP, BTC, and DOGE, starting December 18, 2025.

items.title: Shiba Inu Whale Moves 53 Billion SHIB After Year of Silence
items.summary: A Coinbase-linked Shiba Inu whale resurfaced after a year, transferring 53.59 billion SHIB worth $415,000 from Coinbase, amid SHIB's ongoing yearly drawdown to lows around $0.000012-$0.000015.

items.title: Arthur Hayes Predicts Bitcoin Surge to $200K on Fed's New QE-Like Policy
items.summary: Arthur Hayes forecasts Bitcoin fluctuating between $80K-$100K short-term, potentially reaching $124K-$200K as the Federal Reserve's Reserve Management Purchase (RMP) acts like quantitative easing, boosting liquidity.

items.title: Coinbase Forecasts Crypto Transformation by 2026 with RWA Tokenization and Stablecoins
items.summary: Coinbase's outlook predicts a revamped financial system by 2026 featuring real-world asset tokenization, stablecoin payments, AI-crypto convergence, and application-specific blockchains for enhanced liquidity and efficiency.

items.title: Dr. Stevenson: Banks Need Higher XRP Price for Efficient Cross-Border Settlements
items.summary: Finance expert Dr. Camila Stevenson explains that banks require a higher XRP price to make Ripple's infrastructure economically viable, using a bridge cost analogy amid XRP's 33% three-month decline.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: AWS re:Invent 2025 — Amazon announces Nova 2 upgrades, Bedrock reinforcement fine-tuning, and production-ready browser automation
items.summary: At AWS re:Invent 2025 Amazon unveiled generational upgrades to the Nova model family, a Reinforcement Fine‑Tuning feature in Amazon Bedrock that claims large accuracy gains from reward-driven training, and a generally available browser automation capability (Amazon Nova Act) with a cited ~90%+ task reliability for automating web tasks.

items.title: Nature Communications publishes wearable on-device AI for frailty assessment
items.summary: A Nature Communications paper presents a wearable AI framework performing on‑device inference for gait‑based frailty assessment with clinical‑grade fidelity across in‑vivo trials and extended wear experiments, demonstrating continuous edge operation without user interaction.

items.title: New Purdue initiative to accelerate AI‑driven scientific discovery
items.summary: Purdue University launched an initiative to prepare and curate research datasets to accelerate discoveries driven by artificial intelligence and machine learning across campus research programs.

items.title: Research review: LLMs evolving into autonomous agents for materials and energy research
items.summary: A review outlines the transition from LLMs as knowledge assistants to autonomous agents in energy/materials research, highlighting automated dataset curation, hybrid LLM–GNN architectures, and ongoing limits in robust causal reasoning and planning.

items.title: HHS seeks guidance on using AI to lower U.S. healthcare costs
items.summary: The U.S. Department of Health and Human Services requested expert advice on leveraging AI in clinical care to improve outcomes and reduce costs, signaling increased policy focus on healthcare AI deployment.

items.title: Report: AI‑generated code ships faster but is more error‑prone
items.summary: Coverage summarizes industry findings that AI coding assistants accelerate delivery but produce code with higher bug rates and stability issues compared with human-developed code.

items.title: Video roundup: AI and robotics highlight aggressive 2025 advances
items.summary: A popular YouTube technology channel compiles recent AI and robotics developments in 2025 — from humanoid robots and faster learning agents to debates over autonomous weapons and real‑world deployments.

items.title: University at Buffalo reviews a landmark year in AI and data science for 2025
items.summary: University at Buffalo summarizes its 2025 progress and leadership in AI and data science, highlighting institutional research achievements and continued investment in AI capabilities.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Epic Games Store Offers Eternights as Free Game for December 19-20
items.summary: The Epic Games Store is giving away Eternights for free from December 19 to 20, 2025, continuing their daily free game promotion. Recent free titles include Jotunslayer: Hordes of Hel (December 18-19) and Hogwarts Legacy (December 11-18).[1]

items.title: Steel Ball Run JoJo's Bizarre Adventure Anime Reveals New Trailer and Cast
items.summary: A new trailer for the Steel Ball Run: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure anime was released, announcing Episode 1 premiere on March 19, 2026, along with voice actors for Pocoloco and Sand Man.[6]

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Intel installs first High-NA EUV system at advanced fab
items.summary: Intel has installed its first High-NA (high numerical aperture) EUV lithography system as part of its advanced node ramp, a major step for the company’s leading-edge chip manufacturing capabilities.

items.title: TSMC approved for major Phoenix expansion and commits emissions plan
items.summary: TSMC received approval for a large expansion in Phoenix and announced plans to reduce supply-chain emissions — including adoption of blue ammonia — tied to its U.S. capacity growth.

items.title: SK hynix begins equipment move-in for $15B M15X expansion
items.summary: SK hynix has kicked off equipment move-in for its US$15 billion M15X expansion and is accelerating capacity additions for advanced memory production.

items.title: Samsung unveils Exynos 2600 2nm chipset
items.summary: Samsung introduced its Exynos 2600 built on a 2nm process, boasting substantial performance improvements compared with prior generations.

items.title: Qualcomm completes acquisition of Alphawave Semi
items.summary: Qualcomm has completed its acquisition of Alphawave Semi, strengthening its high-speed connectivity and SerDes IP portfolio for networking and data-center markets.

items.title: Micron reports record quarterly results driven by strong demand
items.summary: Micron reported record fiscal-quarter results, citing robust demand for advanced memory products as a key driver of its performance.

items.title: Netflix acquires Ready Player Me to boost avatars and metaverse content
items.summary: Netflix acquired avatar-maker Ready Player Me to expand its interactive and avatar-driven experiences across gaming and streaming products.

items.title: U.S. Department of Energy partners with major cloud providers on large research mission
items.summary: The U.S. Department of Energy launched a large-scale research collaboration that brings in major cloud and tech providers to support compute-intensive national research projects.

items.title: Google shows strong hiring of former employees amid boomerang trend
items.summary: Google’s recent hiring data indicate a notable boomerang trend, with a significant share of new technical hires being former employees returning to the company.

items.title: Russia-linked phishing campaign targets Microsoft 365 users
items.summary: Security researchers flagged a Russia-linked campaign using sophisticated phishing to steal Microsoft 365 credentials, prompting heightened alerts for enterprise customers.
items.source: The Hacker News (reported in news roundup)
